pages.text: Miscellaneous additions and upgrades to Enchanting in Minecraft.

pages.title: Infini-bucket
pages.text: $(l)Effect:$() Infinity Enchantment can now be applied to Buckets.$(br)$(l)Enchants:$() $(#490)Bow, Bucket$()$(br)$(l)Max Level:$() 1 $(br)$(l)Rarity:$() Rare$(br)$(l)Incompatibilities:$() Mending

pages.title: Vein Miner
pages.text: $(l)Effect:$() Mining tools break multiple blocks in a chunk at once instead of one block at a time.$(br)$(l)Enchants:$() $(#490)Pickaxe, Axe, Hoe, Shovel$()$(br)$(l)Max Level:$() 3 $(br)$(l)Rarity:$() Uncommon$(br)$(l)Incompatibilities:$() Fortune

pages.title: Elytras and Horse Armor
pages.text: Elytras and Horse Armor can now be enchanted in the Enchanting and Imbuing Tables as Armor. This means the talbes will look to apply enchantments like Protection, Thorns, etc.

pages.title: Enchantable Items
pages.text: The following items are now considered Enchantable by Minecraft, and so can be put into an Enchanting or Imbuing Table to be enchanted: Shields, Elytras, Flint and Steel, Shears, Buckets, Horse Armor, Carrots and Warped Fungi on a Stick.
